business.headline: GST Council may replace compensation cess with 2 new levies: ReportIf approved, the dual cess structure could redefine how India funds health and green goals, but only if the Centre and states agree on who pays, who gains, and who decides.

Explained: How India's new gold loan rules will impact lendersThe RBI's directive requires a move towards cash flow-based credit assessments. This means lenders must go beyond just considering the gold's value as collateral.
Sensex ends 83 points lower, Nifty below 24,800; Adani Ports down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 82.79 points to end at 81,361.87, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 18.80 points to close at 24,793.25.

India's rice exports gain edge as Vietnam, Thailand face subdued markets: ReportIndia's rice supply remains strong, with government reserves reported at 59.5 million metric tonnes as of June 1. This figure is over four times the official target for July, highlighting the country's substantial rice stockpile.

Oswal Pumps IPO listing: Will it make a bumper debut? Check latest GMPOswal Pumps is set to debut on Dalal Street on June 19 with high investor expectations. The IPO of Oswal Pumps was oversubscribed by more than 34 times.

Karnataka plans 10-hour days for tech sector employees: ReportAt present, Section 7 of the Karnataka Shops and Commercial Establishments Act, 1961, limits working hours to nine per day, and allows a maximum of 10 hours of overtime in three months.

Your savings account is quietly robbing you, says financial advisorFinancial advisor Lovish Anand has issued a sharp reality check for Indian savers in a recent LinkedIn post titled: "Your Savings Account Is Quietly Robbing You."

Insured, but at what cost?Hospitals are turning into battlegrounds over pending claims, with policyholders watching their premiums shoot up faster than their salaries. Insurance is no longer the comforting shield it once was.

Is Rs 70 lakh per annum the new middle class? Investment banker explainsAre urban professionals struggling even with Rs 70 lakh income per year? A Gurugram-based investment banker breaks down where the money really goes.
Sensex opens flat, Nifty below 24,800; Tech Mahindra shares down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 225.26 points to 81,219.40, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 56.75 points to 24,755.30 as of 9:21 am.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty crash today over US Fed rate cut news?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,782 as of 8:23 am, which suggests that Nifty50 might open below Tuesday's closing level of 24,812.05.
Microsoft to cut thousands of jobs in sales: ReportThe latest round of layoffs follows Microsoft's earlier job cuts in May, which impacted around 6,000 workers across various departments.

Stocks to watch June 19: HDFC Bank, Jio Financial, Hero, Abott, Tata ElxsiWith the US Federal Reserve deciding to keep its key lending rate unchanged, traders and investors in India may react cautiously in today's session.

Air India cuts 15% of international ops till mid-July citing checks, global unrestAir India has temporarily cut 15% of its international widebody flights until mid-July due to Middle East tensions, airspace curfews in Europe and East Asia, and increased safety measures following recent disruptions. This comes after the June 12 Ahmedabad plane crash.

Dassault, Reliance Infrastructure to make Falcon 2000 business jets in IndiaDassault said it aims to deliver the first made-in-India jets by 2028 for corporate and military use, and will cater to rising demand in both Indian and international markets.
Sensex ends 138 points lower, Nifty below 24,900; Titan down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 138.64 points to close at 81,444.66, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 41.35 points to end at 24,812.05.

IPO market heats up with Rs 26,000 crore fundraising in JuneA resurgence in initial public offerings is evident as several major companies plan to launch IPOs in June and July, raising substantial funds.

Explained: Why BSE shares are falling today The drop comes as the company announced a shift in the expiry day of its equity derivative contracts from Tuesdays to Thursdays, effective from September 1, after regulatory approval.

DLF's Rs 11,000 crore Privana North luxury project sells out in a weekSituated in the expansive 116-acre township in Gurugram, this project notched up sales beyond Rs 11,000 crore, highlighting the robust market appetite for premium homes in India's big cities.

Is buying a home in major Indian cities a mistake? Financial advisor explainsFinancial advisor Lovish Anand questions the wisdom of homeownership in high-cost Indian metros, highlighting the economic realities of renting versus buying.

entertainment.headline: Nani calls Meiyazhagan absolute beauty, one of his favourite films of the decadeActor Nani calls 'Meiyazhagan' an absolute beauty and one of his favourite films of the decade. The film's emotional depth and personal storytelling have left a lasting impact on him amidst big-budget cinema.

Mannara Chopra pays final respect to her father, holds his photo close at prayer meetThe prayer meet for Mannara Chopra's father was held on Thursday. The actor appeared heartbroken as she held his photo close while the family visited a Gurudwara for the ceremony.

I knew Thugs of Hindostan would fail but Aditya Chopra didn't agree: Aamir KhanAamir Khan recalls telling Aditya Chopra that their film 'Thugs of Hindostan' needed changes for it to work for the audience, but none of them agreed with his feedback. The actor explains what went wrong with the film.

Actor Rukmini Vasanth's "Tiger Tiger..." caption sparks collab rumours with Jr NTRDirector Prashanth Neel's upcoming film, tentatively titled 'NTR-Neel', starring Jr NTR is yet to reveal the rest of the cast. Ahead of this, an Instagram post by actor Rukmini Vasanth has gone viral for its caption, "Tiger Tiger Burning Bright", sparking rumours of her casting in the film.

Multiplex owners call Aamir visionary for theatre-only release of Sitaare Zameen ParActor Aamir Khan was praised by the Multiplex Association of India (MAI) for the theatre-only release of 'Sitaare Zameen Par'. The multiplex owners emphasised Aamir's bold move and his belief in the magic of cinema.

Not Aamir Khan, Rajkummar Rao to play Ujjwal Nikam in film on 26/11: ReportMaddock Films is not producing a biopic on public prosecutor Ujjwal Nikam. Rajkummar Rao has been roped in to play the lead in the upcoming project.

Naga Chaitanya can't take his eyes off wife Sobhita as she enjoys dosaA video of Naga Chaitanya and Sobhita Dhulipala from Akhil Akkineni's wedding is going viral on social media. In the clip, Sobhita is seen enjoying the delicacies, while her husband looks completely smitten.

Aamir Khan on his father's tough love: His ring left marks on our facesAamir Khan opened up about his relationship with his parents, sharing that while his mother was always loving and calm, his bond with his father was more complex. However, he added that with time, they found peace before his father's death in 2010.

Saira Banu remembers mother Naseem Banu on her death anniversaryVeteran actor Saira Banu paid an emotional tribute to her late mother, Naseem Banu, calling her the first female superstar and a guiding force in her life. She remembered her mother's strength, timeless beauty, and the deep cultural values she instilled in the family.

Shiva Rajkumar, Daali Dhananjaya to star in director Hemanth Rao's next'Sapta Sagaradaache Ello' director Hemanth Rao announced his upcoming collaboration with 'Pushpa' actor Daali Dhananjaya and Shiva Rajkumar for the project, '666 Operation Dream Theatre'.

Thug Life won't release in Karnataka despite Supreme Court order: DistributorsKamal Haasan's 'Thug Life' will not release in Karnataka even after Supreme Court's order. Aravind and Venkatesh Kamalakar, distributors of the film in the state, explained the reason for not releasing the film now.

Shabana Azmi recalls how Farhan Akhtar's input changed the endingShabana Azmi celebrates 25 years of the landmark film 'Fire' with co-star Nandita Das and director Deepa Mehta. She shares how Farhan Akhtar's advice changed the film's original ending, shaping its lasting legacy.

Zeenat Aman recalls her schoolgirl crush on Shashi Kapoor and that first kissActor Zeenat Aman shared her fond memories with 'Satyam Shivam Sundaram' co-actor Shashi Kapoor. From having a schoolgirl crush to sharing their first on-screen kiss, Aman praised Kapoor's warm persona and artistic legacy.

Sachin Tendulkar reviews Aamir Khan's Sitaare Zameen Par with a big thumbs up. WatchCricketer Sachin Tendulkar watched Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' and couldn't stop raving about the power of the film. The actor shared a video in which Tendulkar could be seen giving a thumbs up to the film's team.

Neena Gupta says romance is about feeling good, not just sexVeteran actor Neena Gupta shares her thoughts on love beyond 50 and meaningful roles. She emphasises romance as feeling good rather than just physical attraction, highlighting her fearless career choices.

Kartik Aaryan, Ananya Panday's tanned looks from Tu Meri Main... sets go viralKartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday are currently shooting for 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri' in Croatia. As fans anticipate the film's release, pictures of the two from the sets have gone viral.

Meet Sekhar Kammula, Telugu director who became a star without chasing starsAt a time when Telugu cinema is increasingly leaning on star power and spectacle, director Sekhar Kammula stands out for his quiet conviction. For over 25 years, he has consistently chosen stories over scale, characters over celebrity, and conviction over compromise, making him one of the industry's unique and respected voices.

Priyanka Chopra, Malti have a blast at Disney World with Mickey Mouse and thrill ridesPriyanka Chopra took her daughter Malti Marie on a fun-filled trip to Disney World, where Malti enjoyed her very first roller coaster ride. The duo rode it four times, and the adorable moments quickly went viral online.

Junaid Khan-Sai Pallavi's Ek Din teaser to be attached with Sitaare Zameen ParJunaid Khan teams up with Sai Pallavi for a romantic drama titled 'Ek Din'. The film's teaser will be unveiled in theatres alongside Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' on June 20, 2025.

general news.headline: WhatsApp chats, no show at site: Probe flags Justice Varma's 'unnatural conduct'The inquiry committee has found serious misconduct on the part of Justice Yashwant Varma, from whose residence a huge cash pile was found when a fire broke out there on March 14.

Those who speak English will soon feel ashamed: Amit Shah amid language debateUnion Home Minister Amit Shah said native Indian languages were central to the country's identity and should take precedence over foreign tongues.

Shashi Tharoor admits differences with Congress leadership amid campaign snubSenior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor said that while there are occasional differences with the party leadership, these issues should be resolved internally.

Live: Khamenei can't be allowed to exist, says Israel minister after fresh strikesIsrael-Iran Conflict Live Updates: Israel and Iran continued to launch several missiles at each other for the seventh consecutive day. In a live address, Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei declared that the nation remains united and will not bow to external pressure. Responding to US President Donald Trump's call for Iran to surrender, Khamenei issued a stern warning that any American military strike would lead to "serious irreparable consequences". Trump, on whether the US will attack Iran, said, "I may do it, I may not do it. I mean, nobody knows what I'm going to do." Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

What price is Pakistan's Field Marshal Munir paying for free lunch with Trump?Asim Munir wasn't the only one doing the signalling post-Operation Sindoor. PM Modi also ended weeks of avoiding a showdown with Trump, who had been taking credit for the ceasefire between India and Pakistan.

Why no action against threats: Supreme Court to Karnataka, film body on Thug LifeThe Supreme Court criticised the Karnataka government and state film chamber for failing to act against mobs threatening violence over the film Thug Life, affirming freedom of expression must be protected.

Pak struggles to open air base hit during Op Sindoor, closure extended againPakistan's Rahim Yar Khan air base, which was hit by Indian missiles during Operation Sindoor in May, will remain closed till July 4.

Witnesses saw large pile of cash; Justice Varma filed no complaint: Inquiry panelA Supreme Court-appointed internal inquiry panel said that the unburnt and half-burnt currency at Justice Yashwant Verma's home pointed to his suspicious conduct, rejecting the judge's claim of ignorance in the case.

Inside Dimona: The secretive core of Israel's nuclear powerEven as Israel keeps its own nuclear arsenal shrouded in secrecy, it is actively striking targets linked to Iran, citing Tehran's advancing nuclear research as justification. Meanwhile, satellite imagery over the past five years has revealed major construction at Israel's Dimona facility, with experts suggesting upgrades or even the possible building of a new reactor to boost plutonium production.

For India, Canada looks friendlier than the US at this pointIndia-Canada-US ties: PM Modi's decision to subtly decline Donald Trump's invite was not only strategically significant but also emblematic of the widening trust deficit between the nations. It came as India and Canada quietly signalled a thaw in their two-year-long diplomatic freeze.

Israel strikes Iran nuclear reactor as Netanyahu vows revenge for hospital attackIranian media reported on Thursday morning that air defences were activated in the area of the Khondab nuclear facility, with two projectiles hitting an area close to it.

Bunker busters, bombers, and battleships: How US is preparing for IranThe US has deployed fighter jets, warships, and troops across the Middle East to protect Israel and deter Iran, as Trump warns Tehran and considers options including strikes on nuclear sites.

Worried about US visa rejection over social media? 9 key questions answeredThe US has resumed student visa processing with one big change -- mandatory social media checks. Here's what Indian students need to know before their F-1 visa interview.

Air India black box damaged, to be sent to US to decode crash mystery: ReportAhmedabad plane crash: Presently, India is not equipped to extract data from black boxes that have sustained heavy damage. The temperature in and around the crash site reached about 1,000 degrees Celsius.

Watch: Big explosion rocks Elon Musk's SpaceX base during Starship testingThe incident occurred just before Ship 36 was scheduled for a critical static fire test—a procedure in which the rocket's engines are ignited while the vehicle remains anchored to the ground, serving as a final systems check before launch.

Canada admits to Khalistan extremism on its soil, then accuses India of meddlingNew Delhi has long maintained that Ottawa turns a blind eye to Khalistani elements operating in Canada. The CSIS admission is a long-overdue acknowledgement of the threat.

How Aamir Khan's films are school of perfectionism, one lesson at a timeWith the release of 'Sitaare Zameen Par' on June 20, Aamir Khan returns as Bollywood's beloved moral science teacher. His films are known for blending entertainment with meaningful life lessons.

Zia-Musharraf-Munir: Why the US needs Pakistan's dictatorsA 1947 British war memo shows why Pakistan, not India, suited post-imperial interests — creating a pliant state on Soviet, Iranian, and Arabian frontiers. In 2025, that logic still holds.

Indian football body drops ISL from 2025-26 calendar, future of league in doubtThe All India Football Federation has excluded the Indian Super League from its 2025–26 calendar. This move follows uncertainty over the Master Rights Agreement and pending Supreme Court decisions, casting doubt on the league's future.

Nasa confirms launch time for Indian astronaut Shubhanshu ShuklaNasa said that the change in the targeted launch date provides astronauts aboard the Space Station time to continue evaluating operations after recent repair work.
Sorry Dad, science says mom is the smart oneScience shows moms pass on more than just good looks - they pass on intelligence, too

Karnataka plans 10-hour days for tech sector employees: ReportAt present, Section 7 of the Karnataka Shops and Commercial Establishments Act, 1961, limits working hours to nine per day, and allows a maximum of 10 hours of overtime in three months.

Trump feeds General Munir as wars feed Trump's hunger for Nobel prizeThese are Trumpian times. Countries around the world are fighting among themselves to help him land the next Nobel Peace Prize. It's Trump's last term, he has all the money, he just needs a legacy.
Brass tree, silver pot, paintings: PM's gifts to G7 leaders echo incredible IndiaA look at what Prime Minister Narendra Modi presented to world leaders at the G7 Summit in Canada last weekend.

Nani calls Meiyazhagan absolute beauty, one of his favourite films of the decadeActor Nani calls 'Meiyazhagan' an absolute beauty and one of his favourite films of the decade. The film's emotional depth and personal storytelling have left a lasting impact on him amidst big-budget cinema.

Mannara Chopra pays final respect to her father, holds his photo close at prayer meetThe prayer meet for Mannara Chopra's father was held on Thursday. The actor appeared heartbroken as she held his photo close while the family visited a Gurudwara for the ceremony.

Actor Rukmini Vasanth's "Tiger Tiger..." caption sparks collab rumours with Jr NTRDirector Prashanth Neel's upcoming film, tentatively titled 'NTR-Neel', starring Jr NTR is yet to reveal the rest of the cast. Ahead of this, an Instagram post by actor Rukmini Vasanth has gone viral for its caption, "Tiger Tiger Burning Bright", sparking rumours of her casting in the film.

sports.headline: Take your time: Gill gets advice from Shastri ahead of captaincy bowFormer India coach Ravi Shastri had some key advice for Shubman Gill ahead of his first match as the captain of the Indian Test team. Gill is taking over from Rohit Sharma as the skipper of the Indian Test team.

Pataudi legacy must live on: Sachin Tendulkar on renaming IND vs ENG trophyIndia and England have contested the 'Pataudi Trophy' since 2007. However, starting from the 2025 series, the trophy has been rebranded as the 'Anderson–Tendulkar Trophy'. The batting great has responded to the name change, which has sparked debate within the cricketing community.

RCB's maiden title win makes IPL 2025 final most-watched T20 matchThe IPL 2025 final between RCB and Punjab Kings made history, becoming the most-watched T20 match ever as Royal Challengers Bengaluru lifted their first title after 18 years, setting massive records across TV and digital platforms.

Gill walks the talk, primed to take international stage by storm: KirstenGary Kirsten has heaped praise on Shubman Gill and feels the new India Test captain is a player who walks the talk and is primed to take the international stage by storm. Gill is ready for his first assignment as captain of the Indian Test team.

A dressing room without Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma will feel strange: KL RahulIndia tour of England: KL Rahul said India will miss the experience of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli in the five-Test series, starting June 20. The star batter said the young team in Old Blighty will step up and deliver in the absence of the stalwarts.

Indian football body drops ISL from 2025-26 calendar, future of league in doubtThe All India Football Federation has excluded the Indian Super League from its 2025–26 calendar. This move follows uncertainty over the Master Rights Agreement and pending Supreme Court decisions, casting doubt on the league's future.

If Shubman Gill shows white-ball form at No.4, the world is his oyster: KarthikIndia tour of England: Dinesh Karthik said that if Shubman Gill can replicate his white-ball form at the No.4 spot, then the world would be his oyster. Gill will take over as India's new No.4 in Test cricket after the retirement of Virat Kohli.

Gautam Gambhir will enjoy working with a young captain: Sanjay ManjrekarIndia tour of England: Sanjay Manjrekar believes that Gautam Gambhir will enjoy working with a young captain in Shubman Gill and expects him to bring out results as he has done with the T20I side alongside Suryakumar Yadav.

WTC 2025-27: Who will play the most Tests in new cycle?South Africa clinched the World Test Championship 2023 title with remarkable resilience. Their low number of Test matches has triggered controversy amongst cricket fans.

Test cricket aspirations? Tilak Varma signs County deal with HampshireYoung India batter Tilak Varma has signed with Hampshire for four County Championship matches. His stint coincides with India's ongoing Test series in England.

Jose Mourinho vs Turkish FA: Fenerbahce demand investigation after leaked textsTurkish club Fenerbahce has called for the investigation of the Turkish FA after the alleged leaked WhatsApp messages, which involve Jose Mourinho. It is reported that several members of the organisation have already resigned.

If Shubman Gill shows white-ball form at No.4, the world is his oyster: KarthikIndia tour of England: Dinesh Karthik said that if Shubman Gill can replicate his white-ball form at the No.4 spot, then the world would be his oyster. Gill will take over as India's new No.4 in Test cricket after the retirement of Virat Kohli.

It is reported that several members of the organisation have already resigned.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
